intro: Linostoma calophylloides, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly waxy texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
